result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarah J. Hagen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.

Supervision fees
DNA Sample
Continue with completion of AODA/mental health treatment until successfully discharged by provider
Continued compliance with recommentations of Social Services
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notified Rachel at ONSO paid in full

2:29 p.m. Defendant Sarah J. Hagen in court with attorney Thomas Garrett Wilmouth.  Defendant Sarah J. Hagen in custody.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties in receipt of revocation packet. Court has reviewed Defense sentencing memorandum-State in receipt of copy. Pfeifer/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
Jail - 56 days (time served)
Jail credit - 56 days

Court schedules review date of fines in 15cf214 and 15cf245 for Monday, October 3, 2016 at 3:00 p.m. 
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 2:42 p.m. 
  Review hearing scheduled for October 3, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Notified Judy at ONSO - based on prior payment - Branch 1 cancels warrant
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

11:21 a.m. Defendant Sarah J. Hagen in court with attorney Thomas Garrett Wilmouth.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf214 and 15cf245. State moves to dismiss Counts 2 and 3 in 15cf214 - Granted. State moves to amend 15cf245 to misdemeanor bail jumping - a Class A misdemeanor - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters guilty pleas.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Wilmouth/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
15cf245--Imposed and Stayed
Jail - 6 months with Huber for all purposes
Jail credit - 2 days
POP- 2 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 daysor date provided by Court,  unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
No excessive consumption of alcohol
Continue with completion of AODA/mental health treatment until successfully discharged by provider. 
Continued compliance with recommendatoins of Social Services.

Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.

2:05 p.m. Defendant Sarah J. Hagen in court with attorney Thomas Garrett Wilmouth.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf214 and 15cf245. Wilmouth states have agreement but need to interview one more witness-requests date for plea/sentencing. Bail continued. Adj. 2:06 p.m.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Sarah J. Hagen in court with attorney Thomas Garrett Wilmouth.  Michael H Schiek  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:42 - 
Calling 15cf245 (AIA ) and 15cf214
In receipt of 15cf245, waive reading - set for preliminary - time limits waived - request adj for both cases to be resolved - if not settled - will be set for prelim - both cases.  
Bond continued
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
No intoxicants; no taverns; no contact with KJL

1:34 p.m. Defendant Sarah J. Hagen in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel,  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond. Intra circuit transfer to Branch 2.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
